protocol_name: Preparation of PCR amplicons from edited cells for deep sequencing
protocol_name_html: Preparation of PCR amplicons from edited cells for deep sequencing
description: This protocol describes how to extract and amplify DNA from genome-edited cells, and sequence the resulting amplicons using Illumina MiSeq NGS.
guidelines: See attached word document for notes and guidelines for preparing deep sequencing libraries from edited cells. See attached excel document for a worksheet that can be used to formulate PCR master mixes for amplification with PrimeStar GXL.

components.data:
Prepare the following Master Mix using the initial PCR primers (annealing outside the HDR template region, see guidelines for design requirements), and the PrimeStar GXL polymerase kit from Clontech. Include a master mix-only control.

Master mix (per reaction):

     0.15 µL 100 µM forward primer

     0.15 µL 100 µM reverse primer

     4 µL Takara dNTP solution (2.5 mM each, or 1 µL 10 mM each)

     1 µL GXL polymerase

     30.7 µL H20

     10 µL 5X Buffer

Consider making 10-15% extra master mix to account for pipette error.
components.name: Description

     0.15 µL 100 µM reverse primer

     4 µL Takara dNTP solution (2.5 mM each, or 1 µL 10 mM each)

     1 µL GXL polymerase

     30.7 µL H20

     10 µL 5X Buffer

Consider making 10-15% extra master mix to account for pipette error.

components.data: Mix 4 µL of genomic DNA extract with 46 µL of Master mix in a 96-well PCR plate. Add 46 µL master mix to an empty well as a master mix only control. Mix thoroughly with pipette. Seal plate with tape.
components.name: Description

components.data:
Purify 50 µL PCR with 1.8X SPRI beads, eluting in 30 µL water.

 

1. Add 90 µL SPRI beads to each 50 µL PCR (1.8X ratio), and mix thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Purify 50 µL PCR with 1.8X SPRI beads, eluting in 30 µL water.

 

1. Add 90 µL SPRI beads to each 50 µL PCR (1.8X ratio), and mix thoroughly.

components.data: 2. Place on magnetic stand, wait for solution to clear (~1-2 minutes).

source_data.description: 2. Place on magnetic stand, wait for solution to clear (~1-2 minutes).

components.data:
9. Measure concentration of first PCR using Nanodrop (A260) or Qubit Spectrophotometer.

 

For qubit, use 2 µL Purified PCR per sample, and the 'DNA HS kit'. Follow manufacturer's instructions.

components.data:
2. Confirm proper amplification by running a 2% agarose gel with 5 µL of purified product. Alternatively, you can run the gel on the PCR, before purification.

 

The first PCR product is often impure, especially when amplifying more complex samples (e.g. mouse samples). Confirm presence of the desired band before proceeding with the second PCR.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
2. Confirm proper amplification by running a 2% agarose gel with 5 µL of purified product. Alternatively, you can run the gel on the PCR, before purification.

 

The first PCR product is often impure, especially when amplifying more complex samples (e.g. mouse samples). Confirm presence of the desired band before proceeding with the second PCR.

components.data: QC the first PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: QC the first PCR

components.data:
Place 50 ng of first PCR DNA into a second 100 µL GXL Primestar master mix with the second PCR primers. This produces an amplicon short enough to be sequenced on a MiSeq. Neither primer can anneal to the HDR template. See attached Word document for more design instructions.

 

0.3 µL 100 µM forward primer 2

0.3 µL 100 µM reverse primer 2

8 µL Takara dNTP solution (2.5 mM each, or 1 µL 10 mM each)

2 µL GXL polymerase

XX µL H20 (final volume: 100 µL)

20 µL 5X Buffer

XX µL PCR1 product (50 ng)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Place 50 ng of first PCR DNA into a second 100 µL GXL Primestar master mix with the second PCR primers. This produces an amplicon short enough to be sequenced on a MiSeq. Neither primer can anneal to the HDR template. See attached Word document for more design instructions.

 

0.3 µL 100 µM forward primer 2

0.3 µL 100 µM reverse primer 2

8 µL Takara dNTP solution (2.5 mM each, or 1 µL 10 mM each)

2 µL GXL polymerase

XX µL H20 (final volume: 100 µL)

20 µL 5X Buffer

XX µL PCR1 product (50 ng)

Cycle using the following parameters:

 

7 cycles of:

            98ºC 10 sec

            60ºC 15 sec

            68ºC 30 sec

components.data:
2. Confirm proper amplification by running a 2% agarose gel with 5 µL of purified product. Alternatively, you can run the gel on the PCR, before purification.

 

The second PCR product should be extremely pure, as only the targeted fragment should re-amplify.

components.data:
You now have purified, blunt, PCR product of the appropriate length, ready for adaptor ligation using off-the-shelf NGS kits. To use these kits, start with the "Adenylation step" to A-tail the blunt DNA, and then follow manufacturer's instructions.

 

We will outline the next steps using the Illumina Truseq Nano HT kit (our preference) in the following steps.

 

1. Begin at the "Adenylate 5' ends" step of the protocol. Mix 100 ng of purified PCR product with Illumina RSB (supplied) to a final volume of 17.5 µL.

2. Add ATL mix and A-tail according to manufacturer's instruction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
You now have purified, blunt, PCR product of the appropriate length, ready for adaptor ligation using off-the-shelf NGS kits. To use these kits, start with the "Adenylation step" to A-tail the blunt DNA, and then follow manufacturer's instructions.

 

We will outline the next steps using the Illumina Truseq Nano HT kit (our preference) in the following steps.

 

1. Begin at the "Adenylate 5' ends" step of the protocol. Mix 100 ng of purified PCR product with Illumina RSB (supplied) to a final volume of 17.5 µL.

2. Add ATL mix and A-tail according to manufacturer's instruction.

components.data: Prepare NGS amplicons for sequencing using the Illumina Truseq Nano HT kit
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Prepare NGS amplicons for sequencing using the Illumina Truseq Nano HT kit

source_data.reagent_name: TruSeq Nano DNA HT Library Preparation Kit (96 indexes in plate format, 96 samples)

components.data:
3. Ligate with Illumina Truseq Nano HT adaptors (provided with the kit). Double purify with SPRI (included) as instructed.

 

NOTE 1: We use home-made SPRI beads for PCR cleanup, but NOT for this step. Use the SPRI beads included with the kit ONLY.

 

NOTE: Illumina includes >2X more adaptors than you need in a 96 sample kit. Save unused adaptors for later use!
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
3. Ligate with Illumina Truseq Nano HT adaptors (provided with the kit). Double purify with SPRI (included) as instructed.

 

NOTE 1: We use home-made SPRI beads for PCR cleanup, but NOT for this step. Use the SPRI beads included with the kit ONLY.

 

NOTE: Illumina includes >2X more adaptors than you need in a 96 sample kit. Save unused adaptors for later use!

components.data:
4. Enrich DNA fragments with Illumina proprietary amplification mix/primers.

 

NOTE: The primer cocktail is proprietary to Illumina, and is the limiting reagent in the 96 sample kit.

components.data:
We QC our libraries by three methods:

 

1. Run a 2% agarose gel of your final enriched NGS libraries.

 

Look for an absence of adaptor dimer at ~100 bp. Small amounts of residual adpator can severely affect downstream sequencing!
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
We QC our libraries by three methods:

 

1. Run a 2% agarose gel of your final enriched NGS libraries.

 

Look for an absence of adaptor dimer at ~100 bp. Small amounts of residual adpator can severely affect downstream sequencing!

components.data: QC NGS libraries
components.name: Section

source_data.section: QC NGS libraries

components.data:
2. Quantify libraries using the Qubit Spectrofluorometer.

 

Use the "DNA HS" kit and manufacturer's instruction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
2. Quantify libraries using the Qubit Spectrofluorometer.

 

Use the "DNA HS" kit and manufacturer's instruction.

components.data: QC NGS libraries
components.name: Section

source_data.section: QC NGS libraries

components.data:
3. Pool libraries based upon qubit and gel result.

 

Ask your sequencing facility for pooling requirements. If all the libraries are the same size, you can pool on mass. If not, convert qubit data to molar concentration using an online calculator and pool using that value. Make sure the pool contains an equal molar amount of each library Use a manageable volume for the most concentrated sample, and put an equal mass of each library into the pool. We shoot for a pooled concentration of ~2-5 ng/µL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
3. Pool libraries based upon qubit and gel result.

 

Ask your sequencing facility for pooling requirements. If all the libraries are the same size, you can pool on mass. If not, convert qubit data to molar concentration using an online calculator and pool using that value. Make sure the pool contains an equal molar amount of each library Use a manageable volume for the most concentrated sample, and put an equal mass of each library into the pool. We shoot for a pooled concentration of ~2-5 ng/µL.
